intro: Cybianthus jensonii, commonly known as the Jensen's lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant belongs to the Liliaceae family and is known for its delicate, grass-like foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, moist environment to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
